    level="1"
    right="Feat 16"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Lead the Pack](/Feats.aspx?ID=6276) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=721" />
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=535" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 189 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Beastmaster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=241), [Undead Master](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=176) (Level 16)

**Prerequisites**
[Mature Beastmaster Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=6269); you have multiple animal companions

</column>

---

You can have up to two animal companions active at once. However, when you do, it’s slightly more difficult to Command them. If you don’t Command either of your companions, one of the two (your choice) can still use 1 action on your turn to [Stride](/Actions.aspx?ID=2305) or [Strike](/Actions.aspx?ID=2306), per [Mature Beastmaster Companion](/Feats.aspx?ID=6269), but not both. When you Command an Animal, either choose one of the companions to take 2 actions, as normal, or else each companion can take 1 action to Stride or Strike. Either way, you can’t Command an Animal to make either companion act again until your next turn
